abstract.p: Goldman Sachs Group names Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide to handle its global branding and advertising account; billings estimated at $25 million (S)

block.p: The Goldman Sachs Group said yesterday that it had named Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide in New York, part of the WPP Group, to handle its global branding and advertising account. Billings were estimated at $25 million.

The decision came after a review that had been narrowed to Ogilvy and two other finalists: D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles in New York, part of the B Com3 Group and Mullen in Wenham, Mass., part of the Lowe Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies.

The Goldman Sachs Group said yesterday that it had named Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide in New York, part of the WPP Group, to handle its global branding and advertising account. Billings were estimated at $25 million.

The decision came after a review that had been narrowed to Ogilvy and two other finalists: D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles in New York, part of the B Com3 Group and Mullen in Wenham, Mass., part of the Lowe Group unit of the Interpublic Group of Companies.
Trade publications reported that Ogilvy & Mather joined the review after D'Arcy and Mullen made final presentations last month.
The global branding duties had been handled by Lowe Lintas & Partners Worldwide, part of the Lowe Group unit of Interpublic, until they parted ways several months ago.
Doremus in New York, part of the Omnicom Group, continues to handle so-called tombstone advertising and Mezzina Brown & Partners in New York, handles recruitment communications and advertising.
